intro: Acetosa magna, commonly known as large centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of blue to violet, woolly leaves and its tall, branched stems that bear small, tubular flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and rocky areas. Acetosa magna is known for its medicinal properties, historically used for its diuretic and anti-inflammatory effects. Its growth habit and floral structure make it a distinctive component of its native habitats.
